entries.content:
The Trojan War: 1260 BCE. Known for:

  • the battle between the Greeks and the Trojans
  • the Iliad
  • heroes
  • mythology
entries.caption: Trojan War

entries.content:
The Founding of Rome: 753 BCE
  • establishment of the Roman Monarchy
entries.caption: Rome

entries.content:
I am Romulus, 1st King of Rome. I ruled from: 753 BCE–715 BCE. I am known for:
  • establishing the Roman monarchy
entries.caption: Romulus
entries.copyright: ©Design Pics Historical Collection / Universal Images Group | Britannica ImageQuest 2021

entries.content:
I am Numa Pompilius, 2nd King of Rome. I ruled from: 715 BCE–673 BCE. I am known for:
  • the Temple of Janus
  • the nymph Egeria
  • the calendar change
  • religion/Pontifex Maximus
  • peace during my rule
entries.caption: Numa Pompilius
entries.alt: Statue of Numa Pompilius with a staff couched on a building facade

entries.content:
I am Tullus Hostilius, 3rd king of Rome. I ruled from: 673 BCE–642 BCE. I am known for:
  • being a war-like king
  • building the Curia Hostilia
  • the defeat of the Albans
  • the addition of Albans to Roman Senate
entries.caption: Tullus Hostilius
entries.alt: Sketch of the bust of Tullus Hostilius with Latin inscription underneath it.

entries.content:
I am Ancus Marcius, 4th King of Rome. I ruled from: 642 BCE–617 BCE. I am known for:
  • being the grandson of Numa Pompilius
  • establishing the prison system
  • the defeat of the Latins
  • the addition of Latins to Rome
  • the Mamertine Prison
entries.caption: Ancus Marcius
entries.alt: Coin featuring name and image of Ancus Marius on one side and an equestrian statue over five aqueduct arches on reverse side

entries.content:
I am Tarquinius Priscus, 5th king of Rome. I ruled from: c. 616 BCE–579 BCE. I am known for:
  • the death of Ancus Marcius
  • the Etruscan heritage
  • increasing the Senate
  • plunder funding from wars
  • the Circus Maximus
  • the Temple of Jupiter Optimus Maximus
entries.caption: Tarquinius Priscus
entries.alt: Coin of bust of Tarquinius Priscus with his name on it.

entries.content:
I am Servius Tullius, 6th king of Rome. I ruled from: 578 BCE–534 BCE. I am known for the following:
  • marriage to Tarquinia
  • prophecy by Tanaquil
  • creation of election by Senate
  • the Census
  • creation of five classes
  • the Servian Wall
  • murder of spouses by Tarquinius Superbus and Tullia Minor
entries.caption: Servius Tullius
entries.alt: Drawing of bust of Servius Tullius with Latin text underneath

entries.content:
I am Tarquinius Superbus, 7th king of Rome. I ruled from: c. 534 BCE–510 BCE. I am known for the following:
  • the assassination of Servius Tullius
  • distrust of nobles
  • creation of capital punishment
  • the Cloaca Maxima
  • the Cumaean Sibyl
  • Sextus/Lucretia
  • exile
entries.caption: Tarquinius Superbus
